text:
it's weird you know, php and mysql are so widely used, yet it is so difficult to install??

i have many years experience in sys admin and trying to install apache/mysql/php is just a joke.

so it's not *exactly* a bug, but then again it IS really, because this could and should be SO MUCH EASIER.

i can't get phpapache2.dll to load, apache server says it cannot find the file and yet, there it is, in the directory that IT SAYS IT IS TRYING TO LOAD IT FORM 

BWAHAHAHAHAH!!! what crap!!
creator: wtfbollos@mail.com
covener@gmail.com
text:
This bugzilla is for the http server, not mysql or PHP.

On Windows "cannot find the module" can also mean a dependency of the DLL could not be loaded. So use depends.exe and find your missing dependency / dependency not in PATH/LIBPATH.
it's apache that does not start.
creator: wtfbollos@mail.com
